result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine T Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
*The court will hold in abeyance the DV surcharge until there is verification that it is appropriate to apply the DV surcharge.
*Provide a DNA sample.

*With 2 days credit. Defendant is currently working at a tavern.  If he gets another job and can show proof to the House of Correction of that employment, he can have release privileges for work.  Defendant is to report in no later than 03/07/2016 at 5:00 p.m.
*Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm.

Defendant Jermaine T Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

cab
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 75 days at the House of Correction with 2 days credit.
  Defendant is currently working at a tavern.  If he gets another job and can show proof to the House of Correction of that employment, he can have release privileges for work.  Defendant is to report in no later than 03/07/2016 at 5:00 p.m.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within one year of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
  The court will hold in abeyance the DV surcharge until there is verification that it is appropriate to apply the DV surcharge.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Jermaine T Jackson in court.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is in trial.
.

Defendant instructed to return at that time.

Defendant Jermaine T Jackson in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
On state's motion and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the penalty enhancer, "repeater" dismissed.
As to charge as amended:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case rescheduled to 02/15/2016 at 08:30 a.m., for jury trial.
Defense counsel and the district attorney notified.  Defense counsel informed the court that the defendant is out of custody.  Defense counsel will notify the defendant of new court date.

Defendant Jermaine T Jackson in court with Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Jermaine T Jackson in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38, as it is Branch 38 Intake week.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Defense counsel entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant is Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 38.
